text: The 2018 Louisiana–Monroe Warhawks football team represented the University of Louisiana at Monroe in the 2018 NCAA Division I FBS football season. The Warhawks played their home games at Malone Stadium in Monroe, Louisiana, and competed in the West Division of the Sun Belt Conference. They were led by third-year head coach Matt Viator. They finished the regular season 6–6, 4–4 in Sun Belt play to finish in third place in the West Division. Despite being bowl eligible, they were not invited to a bowl game. == Previous season == The Warhawks finished the 2017 season 4–8, 4–4 in Sun Belt play to finish in a three–way tie for fifth place. == Preseason == ===Award watch lists=== Listed in the order that they were released {| class="wikitable" |- |Maxwell Award |Caleb Evans |QB |JR |- |Fred Biletnikoff Award |Marcus Green |WR |SR |- |John Mackey Award |Josh Pederson |TE |SO |- |Paul Hornung Award |Marcus Green |WR/KR |JR |- |Manning Award |Caleb Evans |QB |JR |- |Earl Campbell Tyler Rose Award |Caleb Evans |QB |JR |} ===Sun Belt coaches poll=== On July 19, 2018, the Sun Belt released their preseason coaches poll with the Warhawks predicted to finish in second place in the West Division.http://sunbeltsports.org/news/2018/7/18/mountaineers-red-wolves- selected-as-division-favorites-in-2018-sun-belt-football-coaches-preseason- poll.aspx {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |align="center" Colspan="3" |West Division |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1 || Arkansas State || 49 (9) |- align="center" | 2 || Louisiana–Monroe || 37 |- align="center" | 3 || South Alabama || 26 (1) |- align="center" | 4 || Louisiana || 25 |- align="center" | 5 || Texas State || 13 |} ===Preseason All-Sun Belt Teams=== The Warhawks had three players at four positions selected to the preseason all-Sun Belt teams.http://www.sunbeltsports.org/news/2018/7/20/sun-belt- announces-2018-preseason-all-conference-football-teams.aspx Offense 1st team Marcus Green – WR 2nd team Caleb Evans – QB RJ Turner – WR Special teams 1st team Marcus Green – KR ==Roster== ==Schedule== The Warhawks will host one of the four non-conference opponents, Southeastern Louisiana from the Southland Conference, and traveled to Southern Miss from Conference USA, Texas A&M; from the Southeastern Conference and Ole Miss from the Southeastern Conference. :Schedule Source: ==Game summaries== ===Southeastern Louisiana=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 11–25 | 2010 | W 21–20 |} ===at Southern Miss=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1–4 | 2017 | L 17–28 |} ===at Texas A&M;=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–3 | 2014 | L 16–21 |} ===Troy=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 7–9–1 | 2017 | L 14–51 |} ===at Georgia State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–1 | 2017 | L 37–47 |} ===at Ole Miss=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–3 | 2008 | L 0–59 |} ===at Coastal Carolina=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1–0 | 2017 | W 51–43 |} ===Texas State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 10–4 | 2017 | W 45–27 |} ===Georgia Southern=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–5 | 2017 | L 21–23 |} ===at South Alabama=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–2 | 2017 | L 23–33 |} ===at Arkansas State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 14–25 | 2017 | L 50–67 |} ===Louisiana=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–5 | 2017 | L 21–23 |} ==Players drafted into the NFL== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- style="text-align:center;
